content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Using ChatGPT-3.5 to Write Code Using ChatGPT-3.5 to write code is like having an experienced programmer helping you. ChatGPT can save you a lot of time coding if you know how to ask! Define the Task Before using Generative AI to help you, set a clear goal for your code. Example goals: Create a specific function Debug existing code In general, clarity and context are important when using Generative AIs, but when using them to write code, it is even more important! For example, write, "Create a function that counts down the number of days and hours until the Choose a Programming Language To get even more specific, specify the programming language you need. If you are unsure of which programming language to use, you can ask ChatGPT: Example With the following prompt: Which programming language should I use to create a countdown to the A response from ChatGPT-3.5 could be: Now we can further clarify our task to: "Create a JavaScript function that counts down the number of days and hours until the Ask ChatGPT for Help Now, we can use ChatGPT to write our code. Imagine you have the following web page: Example

My First Web Page

The weekend is only from now!

Ask ChatGPT to write the code: Example With the following prompt: For the following web page:

My First Web Page

The weekend is only from now!

Create a JavaScript function that counts down the number of days and hours until the A response from ChatGPT-3.5 could be: Then test it: Example

My First Web Page

The weekend is only from now!

It works! Iterate and Develop You can keep working with ChatGPT to improve your code: Example With the following prompt: Add code to display "The Weekend has landed" instead of the countdown if the day is Saturday A response from ChatGPT-3.5 could be: ★ +1
